text: Yeah, I got some solid work done.
Any signs she’s heading to the Promised Land?
Are you more concerned about that than the Huge Materia?
It’s been a dream of mine since I was a kid.
I absolutely have to see it with my own eyes.
Just who the hell are you?
I can see right into that head of yours, prez. You’re scared of me, ain’t ya?
Oh, wait—I can still see more. What’s this?
Fear of your old man, hatred, inferiority—
And deep down, locked away, loneliness.
This planet could use a little more excitement.
Stir it up with that power of yours.
So I’m that interesting to you, huh?
Hey, folks! Where we headin’ next?
Then south it is! Hold on tight, y’all!
You’re actin’ all cozy with us, but what the hell are you?
Me? I’m a smolderin’ employee of Shinra Resort, a wee subsidiary of Shinra Company.
Thanks to ‘em, I’ve been smolderin’ for a mighty long time!
But seriously, folks like y’all? First time I’ve met anyone like ya!
Guess I just like people, huh~!
"Guess I just like people, huh~!" Hahahah! Don’t make me laugh!
No need to get all fired up! Let’s enjoy this nice drive and get along!
You’re gonna take down Scarlet someday, right? I’m totally joinin’ ya when you do!
Yeah...but, looks like you’re the one about to collapse.
I’ll throw all this misery right at her...
All my hatred for that woman...I’ll pile it up for her!
Stop it, stop it, STOP IT!
Hold up! Don’t puke inside, pleeease~!
No sign of the black-robed guys, and wandering aimlessly in the buggy...
Hey, you! I’ll read everyone’s future~!
Barret, didn’t ya mention somethin’ about the Corel Reactor?
Somethin’ about a Weapon or whatnot?
Did I tell you somethin’ like that?
Actually, there’s a shut-down reactor still sittin’ ‘round these parts.
Yes! YES! I’m all in for headin’ to the reactor~!
Well, it sure does pique my interest.
It’s a bit of a trek from here, so what d’ya say?
Cloud, switch with me on driving.
Then off we go to the lush green southern continent! How’s a reactor sightseeing tour sound~?
Cross this, and we’re in Gongaga~!
Hey, what’s the deal with mushrooms? The lucky food mushrooms?
They’re a specialty from a village near the reactor, nya-nya-nya-nn!
A reactor and mushrooms? That safe to eat?
Should be gettin’ close by now~
Well, near the reactor, it’s all thick forest-like!
I don’t see anything like that yet.
Can’t say ‘til we check it out!
Look! Over there—that’s a forest, right?
Bingo! Hang in there a bit longer, Yuffie!
Let’s walk from here. The reactor ain’t too far off.
Oh, and there’s a little village near the reactor too!
How’s this? The reactor ain’t goin’ anywhere, so maybe a quick rest in the village first~?
Walkin’ in silence is borin’ as hell. Spill some Shinra insider dirt.
Well, I got plenty o’ rumors!
Right now, rumors ‘bout President Rufus are bloomin’ like crazy!
Stuff like, "Where’d he get that fancy white suit made!?"
You’re secretly reportin’ where we are to Shinra, aren’t ya?
Aw, c’mon! Just a lil’ joke~!
No matter how ya slice it, you’re Shinra-made. Wouldn’t surprise me if ya had a tiny tracker inside.
President Shinra was the type to make small stuff big instead!
Quit preachin’ your love for the prez, ya Shinra mutt!
Look, look! Gongaga Village is just ahead~!
No way—Gongashrooms? And so many of ‘em!
They’re a delicacy in Midgar, y’know! But ‘round here, they grow like weeds.
What’s your business in this village?
Sorry, you just looked like someone I know.
So what’s your deal here? You don’t look like a reactor survey team.
We’re here to sightsee the reactor! So, yeah, a sightseeing team!
I’m Cissnei, leader of the youth brigade.
Sorry for startling you. Village security’s my job.
You can see the reactor from the hill up there.
As you can see, it’s a quiet village, so don’t stir up trouble, okay?
It’s rich with nature—a nice place. We don’t get many visitors, though.
It’s been a while since I last saw outsiders.
Three years back, the Gongaga Reactor blew up.
If they’d done proper checks and maintenance, the accident could’ve been avoided.
But this memorial? Shinra built it.
Guess the recovery lead here put in some effort.
Don’t mean their sins are forgiven, though.
You must be tired from the long trip. Why not rest up before the reactor tour?
There’s a guest room, sorta—feel free to use it.
The Gongashrooms growing around here? They’re wild, so feel free to pick ‘em.
They’re a luxury in Midgar, right?
I came here after the accident myself.
Compared to Midgar, there’s nothing here, but somehow it feels richer.
The Gongaga Reactor accident coulda been stopped if they’d tried.
Lookin’ at results alone, Shinra Company might as well be reactor bombers themselves.
Aerith was actin’ all fidgety. Maybe she’s got a pal in this village?
Livin’ out here, workin’ a field with Marlene? Might not be half bad.
Me and Marlene doin’ farm work. What should we plant, huh?
What, the lucky food? You buyin’ into that crap?
Still, makin’ bank off Gongashrooms ain’t a bad idea...
Hey, what’s that supposed to mean!?
You tellin’ me to whip up some love potions!?
What’s with you? That’s creepy as hell!
This planet’s still got some fight left. We gotta protect it.
Dry the mushrooms like that, and you’ll get a great stock.
Perfect for soups, stews, or even mixed rice—it’s delicious!
Which one do you wanna try, Cloud?
Which one do you wanna try, Cloud?
Your mom’s stew was out-of-this-world good.
Tell me all about how it tasted sometime.
Um, it’s rice cooked in broth, but—
Oh well, you’ll get it once you eat it. I bet you’ll like it too, Cloud.
The simplest dishes are often the deepest, you know~
Cooking with Gongashroom stock every day? That’s some luxurious living.
Mushrooms can be tricky to identify.
Some might look like Gongashrooms, but they could be dangerous poisonous ones instead.
With this nose of mine, I can tell them apart easily, but Cloud...I wonder.
Can you spot the real Gongashroom?
Correct. The real one’s scent stands out.
It won’t kill you if you eat it, but your body’ll sprout spots just like a Gongashroom.
Try it if you think I’m bluffing.
The left one. Anyone can tell.
Looks like Cloud’s the type to rush toward death.
A word of advice from a friend: Don’t put anything in your mouth when you’re in the mountains.
The soil here feels good. It’s like the power of life is rising up from it.
He ran off after mouthing off, and for a while he sent letters.
When you showed up, I thought for sure you were the girlfriend he mentioned in his letters.
Sorry for pestering you about it.
Zack...I bet he’s got a ton of girlfriends.
As long as he’s doing well, that’s fine, but they say no news is bad news, don’t they?
If...if you ever meet our son, could you tell him to at least get in touch?
Leaving already? Sorry we don’t have much to offer.
No, I’m the one who dropped in out of nowhere.
When I hear someone’s from Midgar, I can’t help hoping they might know my son.
Midgar’s a big place compared to here, though.
Ah, sorry. I was lost in thought for a moment.
Sorry we couldn’t offer much hospitality.
Oh, it’s you. No word from Zack at all.
Really, he could’ve at least shown his face before the war started.
They’re saying another war might break out, right? I wonder if Zack’ll get busy again.
Oh, welcome. Did you manage to meet Zack?
Sorry, that’s not an easy thing, is it?
As long as that boy’s doing okay, that’s enough for me.
If he makes a name for himself in the war, it’ll be in the papers, right? I hope they reach the village.
A war hero...that’s a bit tactless of me, isn’t it?
I told you about Zack, right? You know, how I liked him and all that.
I’d heard this was his hometown.
I thought he looked a little familiar, so I said hi—and it turned out to be his dad.
I didn’t even think about how his parents might feel.
I barged into their home and made them feel lonely.
I made his parents feel lonely.
They both looked happy to me.
Not really. It was probably a nice distraction for them.
Yeah, maybe we should’ve held back.
There’s no reason for me to dislike him.
They said there’s been no word at all.
Any guy who’d leave Aerith hanging has gotta be out of his mind.
If that’s the case, then maybe he’s already—
Cloud doesn’t seem to know Zack at all.
Take it easy and rest up.
If you’re heading to the reactor, get permission from Captain Cissnei first.
Ma-ma-ma, Mate-ri-a~ Wait for me~ Wait for me~♪
Nice tune. Made me laugh. Did you write it yourself?
Yup! Lyrics and music by Yuffie-chan! I’ve got another one—wanna hear it?
Mo-mo-mo, mo-mo-mo-mo~ A big ol’ heap~♪
Mo-mo-mo, mo-mo-mo-mo~ A mega heap~ A mega heap~♪
I really just want one piece of materia, but I’ll sing for you special!
Ma-ma-ma, Mate-ri-a~ Wait for me~ Wait for me~♪
Shut it. Don’t make a racket in someone else’s house.
Ugh, you sound like my dumb old man! Fine, I’ll sing ‘til you give me materia!
Ma-ma-ma, Mate-ri-a~ Wait for me~ Wait for me~♪
Ma-ma-ma, Mate-ri-a~ Wait for me~ Wait for me~♪
Mo-mo-mo, mo-mo-mo-mo~ A big ol’ heap~♪
Mo-mo-mo, mo-mo-mo-mo~ A mega heap~ A mega heap~♪
Did you hear that just now?
It came from the reactor! Let’s check the hill!
Could that be what you’re after?
Somethin’ like that. You got good ears.
It started a few days ago, I think.
The youth brigade went to investigate, but some weird monsters we’d never seen kept us away.
They’re black and buzzing around everywhere. It’s just...creepy. Gives me chills.
Did you get a look at them?
Can’t have you stirrin’ things up and ruinin’ it.
Sorry, but keep her locked down.
We’ll head out quick, check it out, and come back.
So how about me and Cloud’s crew take it on?
Tifa, you guys protect the village.
The reactor’s south. I’ve told the lookouts.
If anything happens, we’ll hold the village. Take care of the reactor.
The reactor’s ahead. Be careful out there.
What’s this "Feelers" thing y’all’re talkin’ about?
They appear before those who try to change destiny, forcing them back on track.
Ain’t seen ‘em in a while, huh?
We escaped the fate set until that day, but we might’ve been swallowed by a new one.
What a wild tale that is~
Feelers aren’t something everyone can see. It should only be us who can perceive them.
Places with reactors are usually burstin’ with energy to begin with.
About half an hour, I’d say.
Which one should I use first?
Will there even be a chance to use them?
Oh my, all this water’s pooled up!
Meetin’ a Weapon ain’t gonna be a walk in the park.
Ain’t there more of those buzzin’ punks now?
Are they trying to guide us?
If we wanna cross to the other side, we’ll need to raise the water level.
Let’s look for the control unit!
Commencing drainage. Please evacuate the flooded area.
Authentication error. Authentication error. Insufficient power supply.
Barret, what d’ya plan to do once ya meet this Weapon?
Who’re ya plannin’ to fight? Who’s the enemy here?
Sephiroth. Course, I’m gonna shut down the mako reactor too!
The reactor aside, Sephiroth’s been dead for five years, ya know.
You’d get it if ya fought him once yourself.
Hmm, hard to believe that outta the blue!
This is way beyond what I imagined!
The reactor’s dead, but the mako’s reachin’ all the way out there!
It’s definitely growin’. Shuttin’ down the reactor wasn’t for nothin’!
The mako’s gettin’ on my nerves.
You didn’t call ‘em here, did ya?!
No way, no way! I’m innocent!
Like flies swarming to the stench of mako.
Gotta clean up before we go treasure hunting, don’t we?
Come on, hustle! Retrieve that Huge Materia!
What’s with the dawdling? Hurry up, or it’s "foot punishment" for you!
Nothing but useless fools. Can’t even kill a single fly?
As expected from vermin—stubborn little pests.
Professor Hojo’s pride and joy. Play with it to your heart’s content!
This gas is pissin’ me off!
Retrieve the Huge Materia and get back quick.
Let’s meet up at the village exit!
The area around the reactor’s full of rubble, so it should come in handy.
I’ve got a bad feeling something big’s about to happen.
My hunches are usually spot on.
We’ll all make it back—together, no matter what.
Where should we go in from?
Let’s head up with the wire gun.
I won’t let ya say you forgot my face!
We’ll be your opponents. No holding back—how’s that?
Being called an old hag doesn’t even faze me anymore.
It just makes me endlessly, utterly,
Scream nice and loud for meeee!
I won’t let you get away!
Go! No way I’m lettin’ her have that materia!
I just love this kinda thing.
The wound again? I showed you already, didn’t I?
Long ago, Jenova approached people in the form of loved ones or feared ones, deceiving them.
So, if Cloud gets famous someday and I’m in trouble then...
Cloud, you’ll come save me, right?
A hero saving me in a pinch—
I’d love to experience that at least once, y’know?
Let’s all cross Mt. Nibel together!
Even if we cross the mountain, your mom won’t be there.
You want to live—keep living, fight to live. Wish for it with all you’ve got!
Your life is tied to the feelings of so many people.
Tifa, the fight ain’t over yet!
No way! I can’t see a thing!
Get it together! We’re takin’ Tifa back!
When people die, they cross Mount Nibel and set off on a journey. Do you remember that?
It’s just a tall tale to keep kids from wandering into the mountains.
You believed it though, didn’t you, Tifa?
No, even I had my doubts.
But I forced myself to believe it. I wanted to see Mom that badly.
Emilio and the others cheered me on, so we all started climbing together.
But those guys left you behind and went back.
I fell off a cliff halfway up and hit my head, right?
For about six months after that, my memories are kind of a mess.
Everyone told me all sorts of things, so I just pieced it together like, "Oh, so that’s how it was..."
That you egged me on, Cloud.
Thank you. You were a hero that day, Cloud.
That day, I fell off the cliff with you. Yesterday, I dropped you into a mako reactor.
Sometimes, I don’t even know who I am.
I don’t know things I should, or I know things I shouldn’t.
It’s like there are multiple versions of me.
And I can’t tell which one’s the real me.
Inside the Lifestream, there’s a battle between the planet and the black Feelers.
The black Feelers—could they be Sephiroth?
That’s what it felt like to me, anyway.
The battle inside the planet—who’s winning?
The planet’s fightin’, burnin’ its life away right this second!
Oh...I can hear the planet’s screams now!
We’re gonna fight some bastard like Sephiroth—don’t even know what he is!
And for that, we’ll need the planet’s power! We help it, it helps us, and we fight together!
Sounds like a pretty grand tale.
If you’re talking about something like that, I know just the place for it.
The holy land of planetology! Wait, ain’t it around here?
If there’s materia, I’m in! Totally, absolutely in!
Since ancient times, it’s been a place where the planet’s power and wisdom gather. Materia? You’ll find plenty.
Alright then, how about a pilgrimage to the holy land!
If you’re heading to Cosmo Canyon, check this place out first.
There’s an old national airfield near the village. You can catch a rogue plane there.
Head out the gate south of the village, and you should get there.
He’s taken a real liking to you all. Feel free to take him along if you’d like.
If you need anything else, stock up in the village before you go.
Use a chocobo to get to the airfield.
It’s a long trip to Cosmo Canyon, so make sure you’re prepared.
Say, while we’re at it, why nae peek at the bulletin board?
Odd jobs and handyman work—truth is, I’ve always wanted tae try it!
Ain’t got time to mess around!
Callin’ my pure desire to help ye all "messin" around’—that’s harsh!
Who knows? Can’t trust a damn thing Shinra says!
Mew! Still at zero trust, eh?
Last night ye held me so tight and warm, yet here we are!
Must’ve mistaken you for Marlene! Quit talkin’ like that, damn it!
Hey, hey, what’s a rogue plane?
Since the Republic fell, the skies belong tae Shinra, aye?
Anything flyin’ up there—besides birds—is under Shinra’s thumb.
And yet, some fly around without their say-so!
The sky don’t belong to no one! Screw Shinra!
Maybe they’re flyin’ up there givin’ ‘em the finger!
Hey, this looks like the airfield...right?
Holes everywhere, popping up all over!
Ye cannae take off or land on this, can ye?
What?! We came all this way for nothing?
A telebox from the Republic days! Shall we check it out?
If you need assistance, raise a signal fire. ――Bronco Aviation
Gotta raise a signal fire, looks like.
Whaaat? You don’t know?! That’s so like a sheltered little princess!
Hee hee hee hee...Leave it to meeee!
Fine, time for my trump card!
Told ya, told ya! How’s that!
We want to go to Cosmo Canyon.
It talked! What kinda trick is this?
Well, when you’re soaring the skies, you see all sorts of things.
But, well, it ain’t like you can’t fit.
With hazard pay included, how’s this sound!
Things’ve been slow lately. I’ll wait ‘til I’ve got cash in hand.
Hey, line ‘em up nice and neat for me.
Cancellation fee plus fuel back’ll run ya about a billion gil, give or take.
Hey, hurry it up! I ain’t got all day here!
Wafflin’ around won’t get ya any girls, kid!
Hey, line ‘em up nice and neat for me.
Hey, hurry it up! I ain’t got all day here!
Get on board like I tell ya. Gotta balance the weight, y’know.
Hold on tight! I ain’t pickin’ ya up if ya fall!
Damn right we are! Who d’ya think I am?!
Bronco Aviation President and Pilot, Cid Highwind.
Lookin’ forward to workin’ with ya!
To agree with my research and volunteer to assist—you’re one hell of a SOLDIER.
Oh, hold still now. I won’t take responsibility if this goes wrong.
For a sensible guy like you, I’ll give you special treatment.
Treatment to become a hero, that is.
Used to take years back in the day, but now? Eighteen hours—just eighteen hours.
And it’s all thanks to me.
Technology advances every day, all by my hand.
Though rushing it does come with some drawbacks.
The original’s a rare commodity these days.
Now, become mine like the puppet you are!
Not if I can help it!
For stopping the Queen...for stopping me.
I got full of myself, thinking I was some genius.
But deep down, I was scared of losing, desperately chasing power.
And this is what it got me.
It’s the kind that slips into the cracks of your mind, gaining strength as it spreads.
Resisting it is no easy task.
There’s no such thing as a natural genius. It’s all the result of hard work, isn’t it?
I’ve gotta start over from scratch.
If the Queen tries to rise again, I’ll be ready to take her down myself next time.
I won’t lose next time, so let’s have a rematch, okay?
Wouldn’t do to have you die here.
It seems there are several undetectable areas within the Gongaga region’s communication tower range.
If there’s technology capable of evading the Republic’s search network, then it’s likely—
The fact that we can’t detect Ancient Materia energy in this area might also—
I’ve marked the nearby unidentified areas on your map.
Please be careful if you head out to investigate.
I’ll hack the surveillance system, so please wait a moment.
It looks like this was a Shinra training facility.
In Gongaga? Never heard of it.
It seems its existence was erased from official records long ago.
Currently, it’s being used by the General Affairs Auditing Division.
I’ve prepared forged IDs for you all. Let’s use them to investigate inside!
ID data verification in progress. Identification number: GAI224
Confirmed as a member of the Turks, General Affairs Auditing Division, based on identification number.
Welcome to the Turks training facility.
As you know, Turks’ work often puts your life on the line.
Failure in a mission means death. Assume there’s no guarantee of survival, even in training.
Now, let’s proceed with this mission briefing.
The outer wall of Kalm has been destroyed by an anti-Shinra group, allowing monsters to invade the city.
The military’s fighting back, but the enemy’s taking advantage of the chaos to seize the city.
Our mission is to swiftly apprehend the mastermind who’s lying low.
Get to training as soon as preparations are complete.
I’ve detected a faint response from Ancient Matter within the deployed mission data.
It means all you folks need to do is go wild in the training mission, and we’re good to go!
Monsters have breached the outer wall. Eliminate them immediately.
New monsters have broken through the military barricade.
Guard dogs protecting their master, huh? The mastermind’s close—don’t let ‘em slip away.
Impressive efficiency. We’re counting on you in real combat too.
Room for improvement, but a decent performance.
Too much wasted movement. Points deducted.
The mastermind’s been harboring a deep grudge against Shinra since an incident eight years ago.
Claims his hometown was taken over by Shinra.
There are plenty like him who resent Shinra. Nipping these threats in the bud is part of our job.
This facility will soon switch to recharge mode.
Collect your supplies and move to the next training ground.
Everyone, take a look at this!
It’s still being analyzed, so it’s unstable for now.
It seems the Ancient Matter in this area has been converted and stored within the training data.
Can we take it with us?
At this point, it’s hard to say...
Let’s head to the next facility to further the analysis!
What’s with this "nip threats in the bud" nonsense?! Those Turks actin’ all high and mighty!
If they didn’t do stuff to make people hate ‘em, they wouldn’t get what’s comin’ to ‘em! Karma, baby! Oh-ho!
But not everyone at Shinra’s bad. Most of ‘em are...good people. That’s the problem.
That’s not "good people"—that’s people who don’t think at all!
That’s why they can do awful stuff without battin’ an eye!
It’s been a while since our last investigation, so let me bring you up to speed again.
The Ancient Matter in the Gongaga area...
...seems to have been converted into data and stored within the Turks’ training facility.
Please continue investigating the training facilities to help restore the Ancient Matter data.
Arrival at the training facility confirmed.
Surveillance cameras have been hacked. Let’s investigate the interior using forged IDs.
Verifying ID data. Initiating authentication test.
This is the mastermind we captured in the last mission—the one behind the monster invasion.
We Turks are always required to make precise and cold-blooded judgments.
So, what do we do with this guy?
What to do with the mastermind?
Anyone who defies Shinra gets eliminated.
A valid choice for a Turk, but in this case, it’s the wrong call.
Letting him loose to track his moves is an option, but you haven’t considered the risk of losing him.
Judging from the Kalm incident, it’s hard to believe their sole goal was occupying the town.
We need to interrogate this man to uncover the enemy’s true objective.
The interrogation revealed that the Kalm incident was a diversion to split our forces.
Their main unit infiltrated Junon to hijack Shinra’s weapon control system.
This mission involves neutralizing security weapons hacked by the enemy organization.
Locate and destroy the targets swiftly.
Gettin’ their own weapons turned against ‘em? Pfft, serves ‘em right!
Preparing for every scenario—that’s what makes the Turks the Turks, right?
Yeah, sometimes I think we can’t keep up with ‘em.
Rogue weapons spotted! Senior, take ‘em out!
Gah! A ton of machines are headin’ your way!
Looks like that’s the last of ‘em. Finish it quick and let’s head back to HQ!
I’ll handle the report to Tseng, so you and Rude go grab a drink or somethin’!
Well done. Keep honing your skills like this.
You’ve passed, but as Turks, never forget to always give your all.
Some sacrifices are inevitable in a mission, but this wasn’t the optimal approach.
Shinra Company’s military might currently holds overwhelming global dominance.
But...that’s exactly why plots like this one keep cropping up to exploit it.
No matter the situation, resolving it swiftly is our duty.
This facility will soon switch to recharge mode.
Collect your supplies and move to the next training ground.
The analysis has progressed since last time, but we’re still a bit short on data.
Let’s head to the next one!
That "battle simulator" thingy—can’t it do, like, anything?
One of those oughta be plenty!
Originally, they were used differently depending on the unit and purpose.
Now they rotate multiple facilities to conserve power.
We’ll skip the authentication test. This mission is—
I’ve told them countless times I don’t need escorts, but they won’t listen.
This mission is VIP protection in Junon, which has been infiltrated by the enemy.
Protect the president from enemy forces disguised as Shinra soldiers until the transport chopper arrives at the airport.
Ooh, I wanna be on the enemy team!
Yeah, might end up hitting the wrong side.
Enemy vanguard’s advancing your way. Stay sharp.
Ugh, sorry, Senior! We couldn’t hold ‘em back over here.
Enemy elite squad’s heading your way. They’re getting serious now.
Hold out till we get there, Senior!
Looks like you made it out fine.
Your reward...Name your price, and it’s yours.
Quite a thrilling time. Good work on the escort.
I’ll take this as a warning that I should protect myself from now on.
To our company, the president is the one and only absolute.
We Turks must protect him even at the cost of our lives.
Carry that resolve into every mission ahead.
This facility will soon switch to recharge mode.
Collect your supplies and move to the next training ground.
We’re almost done restoring the data!
Alright! We’ve come this far—let’s finish it and show ‘em what we’re made of!
The final mission is to eliminate Turks who’ve betrayed the organization.
Former Turks Rude and Elena kidnapped the president during transport and fled.
The Turks’ code demands we eliminate traitors without exception.
Assume they’re coming for us with every intent to kill.
Kill or be killed—we’re always forced to choose one or the other.
Just ‘cause they betrayed you...you can really think that way so easily?
Maybe that’s what being a Turk is.
Been a while since we last sparred like this, huh?
We know each other’s moves inside out. No holding back.
‘Cause if we do, we’re the ones goin’ down!
Snap out of it already, partner.
They shove all the company’s dirty work on us—and what do we get out of it?
If this keeps up, we’re gonna die of overwork for sure! And a no-dating rule on top of that? That’s insane!
We’re gonna dry up like husks!
Come at me, and I won’t show mercy.
Never thought it’d come to this, partner.
Senior, can’t we just talk this out?
Keep this up, and you’ll collapse too!
Senior, let’s ditch this fight and take a vacation with us!
C’mon, doesn’t Costa sound like a blast?
Joining up with Avalanche might not be a bad idea.
The blue sea’s waitin’ for us, y’know?
Ugh, guess convincin’ you was a waste!
Hmph. A Turk through and through, huh? Then...
Looks like we’ve gotta take you out, Senior!
Shame it had to end, partner.
Thanks for everything—it was short but sweet!
Congratulations. You’ve proven yourselves worthy Turks.
I’m not happy about this at all.

Based on recognition code, identified as a member of the General Affairs Investigation Division—Turks—

I’d rather you not cause more trouble.

Chadley, what’s up with the Ancient Matter?

Looks rough around the edges, but the details are thought out real good.
Bet it was built by an engineer specializin’ in somethin’ totally different.
A weaponsmith wouldn’t come up with this.

There’s a map with the material spots jotted down in the storage shed.
Head to the shed first and look for the map.
The material locations are written on the map in the shed.
Go to the shed first and find that map.
Hit those spots on the map, and you’ll find the materials. Watch out for monsters.

Your arm’s the perfect example of that.

First, head to the shed and look for the map, alright?

Hehehehe! It’s coming together real nice, ain’t it?

For the village, obviously! Monsters have been popping up more lately.

Alright, your spirit’s good to go!

So, let’s jump straight into some real combat training!
A true shinobi’s gotta be able to zip over to their buddies in a pinch!
Got it! Then I’ll wait right here.
Then I’ll wait here. I’ll keep waiting, no matter how long!
Looking forward to your guidance, Master!
Wanna hide like a shinobi? The forest’s the place!

Show me how it’s done, Master!
We’ve got all the time in the world!
I’m gonna scout around a bit, so take a break or whatever.

Awesome! I just had an idea!
You both trained me so hard, but I couldn’t do a thing...

Why not take a break here?

I think he’s around the plaza near the village entrance.
Togan’s veggies are famous for being tasty. I think he’s around the plaza near the village entrance.

But Pippi-chan, Pee-chan, Pippipi-chan, and Pipipi-chan all took off.

Looks like it’s time for my nose to shine.
Heh heh heh, my nose is up for the job!

That spot looks suspicious. Let’s check it out.

Aerith, you’re really a good person. You’re amazing...I get it.
Alright, let’s head back to the village.
I’ll head back to the village soon.

Th-Th-This! The story’s coming together like crazy!
A crimson warrior, exiled from the forest for betrayal.
A crimson warrior, exiled from the forest for betrayal.
The warrior...well, I’m not sure why, but they set off alone to an unknown land.
The warrior...well, I’m not sure why, but they set off alone to an unknown land.
A crimson warrior, beloved by all as the forest’s king.
Seeking true strength, the warrior set off alone to an unknown land.

On their journey, three princesses appeared before the warrior. The princesses confronted them.
On their journey, three knights appeared before the warrior. The knights declared:
"You are the destined king! Come, let us fight together!"
The warrior lost it and let out a wild howl.
The warrior lost it and let out a wild howl.
"Life’s full of surprises. Forget past mistakes and live for now."
"Life’s full of surprises. Forget past mistakes and live for now."
Seeing the vast world ahead, the warrior steeled themselves.
"I won’t end as the forest’s king. A new battle awaits. My future lies beyond!"

I’m so done with the reactor causin’ headaches.
Did the youth brigade take care of that black fuzzy stuff?
That loud voice from the reactor? Can’t hear it anymore.
Come back anytime if you start missin’ this place.
Gongaga’s always laid-back, takin’ it nice and slow.
No matter what happens, we’ll protect the forest’s green.
Gongaga’s air tastes like peace, don’t it?
Heard somethin’ about a war brewin’. That true?
Everyone in this village is like family, y’know.
Days with lotsa monsters, you can tell by the forest’s smell.
Welcome to Gongaga, the village of mushrooms and fields!
Man, it’s been a while since I last said that! Take it easy here.
Welcome to Gongaga, the village of mushrooms and fields!
Don’t get lost in the forest, alright?
Watch out for monsters, watch out for monsters! One slip-up and you’re hurtin’.
Watch out for monsters, watch out for monsters! Leave it to the youth brigade, no worries!
The youth brigade’s job is basically village security and chocobo care. Got it?
Newbies train while tendin’ to the chocobos. Good luck!
Here ya go, here ya go!
Yep, from now on, I’m sleepin’ with books as my pillow!
Lookin’ for a book on growin’ tasty veggies.
For killin’ time, thick books are the best, right?
Just like nutrition, balance is key for powering up.
We’re an item shop that sells materia too!
Oh, a customer! Take your time browsin’.
No veggies as a bonus...guess you don’t want ‘em.
Stockin’ up on feed for the sheep. Check!
Here it is—our pigs love this stuff.
Maybe I’ll go for the pricier feed this time.
Whoops, sorry! Was at a good part in my dream.
Yaaawn—thought I dreamed a customer showed up.
An axe’d probably cut through thick logs easy.
Hmm, wonder if they’d trade for veggies.
There’s this weapon smith named Izo.
Some drifter who’s always holed up in the forest workshop.
He’s obsessed with makin’ the ultimate weapon, groanin’ about it every day.
Too loud, so nobody goes near him.
Izo the weapon smith’s doin’ pretty good lately.
You can hear him workin’ in the forest workshop, hummin’ along with the sounds.
What’s this "ultimate weapon" anyway? Might go hear him brag about it.
Hell yeah! Let’s take a break at the Gongaga Saloon!
One sip and the tiredness is gone. That bitterness is addictin’ as hell!
Hell yeah! Used to be hooked on booze, now I’m a Jungreen junkie.
Good to see ya! Take it easy here.
Made with heaps of Gongaga mushrooms and fresh veggies.
How’s that? Hits the spot, huh?
Fresh veggies are best eaten raw.
Mmm, these tomatoes are so shiny!
Thanks to fresh veggies, my skin’s all smooth and shiny.
When I drink Jungreen, I hold my nose like this.
Gimme some Gongaga mushroom and pork sauté.
Alright, let’s settle the Gongaga mushroom deal price with a Jungreen chugging contest!
Challenge accepted! Just so ya know, I’ve got a bottomless stomach!
Whoever downs the most cups wins!
Alright, let’s start the regular meetin’. Topic’s crow countermeasures—how’d it go?
I tried makin’ a new scarecrow, but it didn’t work.
If anything, it attracted ‘em more. They’re smart little buggers.
Hung up a picture of myself, and now crows and weasels won’t come near!
Oh yeah, you’ve always been hated by animals.
The more effort you put into Gongaga mushrooms, the better the flavor gets.
Gongaga mushrooms are this village’s specialty.
The secret to their deliciousness is pourin’ in the love.
Feed ‘em well to fatten ‘em up. Makes the meat juicy and sweet!
Sad, but even if we eat ‘em, they’ll return to the planet and be reborn.
Huh!? So this one’s someone’s reincarnation too?
See anything over by the reactor?
Some monster I’ve never seen showed up. The youth brigade’s lookin’ into it.
Gongaga’s a peaceful village, but lately it’s been gettin’ dicey.
That monster that popped up at the reactor—any news on it yet?
Hope nothin’ else happens at the reactor.
A weird monster showed up, and the youth brigade’s investigatin’.
Munch munch...This is the best snack ever!
Eat that much and you’ll get a nosebleed! You got scolded last time for overeatin’ too.
This much? No problem, no problem!
How many years has it been since we got together?
So long I’ve lost count. How many fights we had, anyway?
Heheh, thanks to you, every day’s a happy one.
Looks like we’ve got a long road ahead. Well, take it easy on me, alright?
Hey, nice weather again today! Perfect for farmin’.
Damn crows got my field again.
Alright, alright, time to get dirty with the soil.
Gonna go fix the fence the sheep busted up.
Alright, time to tackle the laundry today!
What veggies should I use for lunch soup?
Got a bunch of eggs today, better drop some off next door.
Sorted the potatoes, next up’s tomatoes.
Oh, you want some veggies too?
Shinra sent a survey team in an airship, right?
Gotta protect Gongaga’s chill, easy days.
Heard Shinra’s reactor survey team showed up?
Whenever somethin’ happens at the reactor, it reminds me of that old accident.
The youth brigade’s still lookin’ into that weird monster, right?
Can’t wait for harvest time now.
Be nice to share some with everyone.
Gotta split it fair, or the grannies’ll nag me to death.
People of the planet, lend your ears to its voice.
Gongaga still holds the fading bounty of rich harvests.
But beware—the planet cries out in agony now.
Soon, the fields that bear fruit will wither, and the green forest will be overrun by black monsters.
We must not let the Lifestream fade.
Now is the time to embrace planetology, learn, and prolong the planet’s life.
The time has come to set out for the sacred Cosmo Canyon.
Come, let us save the planet with our strength!
Alright, let’s talk about the old days today.
The tragic accident that struck Gongaga Village.
Y’all know the Gongaga reactor, right?
Back when it was built, we barely went near it—left it all to Shinra.
But three years ago, the reactor suddenly blew up.
A ton of debris and mako smoke rained down on the village. The crops withered, and everyone’s families in Gongaga suffered terribly.
Just thinkin’ about it still gives me the chills.
Shinra built a fine memorial for us after all that.
It’s the biggest tomb in the village. So many families are restin’ there.
All us survivors can do is make sure we never forget that awful accident.
Listen up—don’t you dare skip visitin’ the graves.
Showin’ ‘em how much you’ve grown is the best way to honor ‘em, y’know.
He’s one of the best veggie growers here in Gongaga.
Old Man Togan’s veggies are so popular, they sell out the second his peddler dog shows up.
Old Man Togan’s veggies are packed tight and bursting with fresh, juicy flavor.
We’ve gotta figure out how he grows stuff that good—time to learn from the master!
Old Man Togan’s veggies are downright delicious.
Goya’s always such a good girl, ain’t she?
The youth brigade’s out investigatin’ some weird stuff near the mako reactor right now.
New kinds of monsters keep poppin’ up. It’s freaky, huh?
Our rare moment to shine...It’s finally here!
There might be a huge monster lurkin’ around the mako reactor.
We asked Shinra to send a survey team, but no word back yet.
That black thing at the reactor? It’s not in any monster guide I’ve seen.
We mix some Gongaga mushrooms into their feed, y’know.
Brushing the chocobos? I wanna try it too!
One chocobo, two chocobos...Huh, I’m gettin’ sleepy~
We’re keepin’ up the investigation around the mako reactor from here on out!
Haha, those swarmin’ creeps took one look at us and hightailed it outta there!
Our rare moment to shine...Never came, huh.
The mako reactor looks dead, but maybe it’s still alive somehow.
Shinra’s survey team showin’ up in an airship? That’s my doing, thank you very much!
Wonder if that black thing’ll ever make it into a monster guide someday.
Alright, how about some practice swings?
Next, pair up for a mock battle. Let’s go!
Hey there, takin’ good care of the chocobos?
What’s that? I heard that voice again, didn’t I?
Is somethin’ goin’ down at the mako reactor?
Huh? What’s that? What’s goin’ on?
Hey, that’s a Shinra military craft, right?
Everyone, stay calm and get inside!
So the reactor survey team finally showed up, huh?
What the heck is goin’ on out there?
Stay calm—even if somethin’ happens, we’ve got your back!
It’s alright, the youth brigade’s got this.
Welcome to Gongaga’s port! The sea’s nice and calm today, as usual.
Managing supplies is part of the youth brigade’s job too.
We store export-ready Gongaga mushrooms here. Smell that? Nice aroma, huh?
The lush green forest is great and all, but the gentle blue of the sea soothes me too~
